content:
• Friday, November 18, 2016

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: UNG +6.5%. OIL +6.1%. USO +5.6%. BNO +5.0%. FCG +3.8%.
    • Top losers: VXX -7.6%. KOL -5.3%. PSLV -5.3%. SLV -4.5%. SIVR -4.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • FB

    Facebook authorizes $6B Class A share repurchase

    • To go into effect Q1 2017 with no set expiration.
    • Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) shares higher by 1.26% to $118.50 after hours.
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 71 Comments
  • ET

    Dakota Access pipeline reroute will not be considered, CEO Warren says

    • Energy Transfer Partners (ETP +3%) CEO Kelcy Warren says the company will not consider rerouting its Dakota Access oil pipeline despite concerns from U.S. native groups, according to an AP interview.
    • Warren says he would welcome the chance to meet with the head of the Standing Rock Sioux tribe to address concerns that the $3.8B pipeline would endanger drinking water and cultural sites, but says ETP has no alternative than to stick to its planned route.
    • The 1,200-mile pipeline is largely complete except for a section that would pump oil under Lake Oahe, a Missouri River reservoir in southern North Dakota, and Warren says "we're going to cross the river at that location," calling it the "least impactful" site.
    • Warren's latest remarks follow his recent NPR interview in which he expressed his determination to complete the project in spite of growing protests.
    • Also: ETE +3.7%, SXL -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 57 Comments

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: IPDN +14%. OTEL +12%. MRVL +10%. TTD +9%. NUAN +9%.
    • Losers: SCON -36%. KONE -11%. AIRG -11%. ASYS -10%. PI -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • AMH

    Insider buy at American Homes 4 Rent

    • Daughter of founder Wayne Hughes and a member of the board, Tamara Gustavson purchased more than 80K shares of American Homes 4 Rent (AMH +2.1%) this week at just over $20.50 each. Her stake in the company is nearing 13M shares.
    • Gustavson also put more money to work last week in Public Storage - also founded by her father, and on whose board she sits.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • COP

    ConocoPhillips planning to sell Alaska Kenai LNG export terminal

    • ConocoPhillips (COP +2.9%) says it is in the process of selling its Kenai liquefied natural gas export terminal in Alaska, and will open a "data room" associated with the sale in January.
    • COP says its current focus is on North Slope operations; COP has a nearly $1B capital budget for Alaska in 2016, and has accepted delivery of two new drilling rigs this year.
    • COP says it has not exported any gas so far in 2016 because of market conditions, but the Kenai plant remains operational and ready to resume exports.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 12 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: TRCH +19%. CLD +17%. UAN +10%. NAK +10%. ECR +9%.
    • Losers: CETC -31%. GBR -10%. CGG-OLD -8%. LEI -8%. CHNR -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • ANDV

    Tesoro deal for Western Refining fills gap with Permian exposure

    • Tesoro (TSO -3.7%) and Western Refining (WNR -2.7%) are lower a day after their merger announcement that will make TSO the fourth biggest U.S. refiner by capacity.
    • Analysts see the deal filling a gap in TSO's portfolio by giving it access to pipelines and refineries that connect to Texas' lucrative Permian Basin
    • WNR's primary business in the formation is gathering - collecting oil from remote fields, pooling it together and bringing it to a hub - and TSO's acquisition is said to reflect the conviction that refiners with pipelines and other logistical assets can be profitable through volatile price cycles of crude oil and refined products.
    • WNR is downgraded to Sector Perform from Outperform at RBC Capital, which says it does not foresee an increased offer or an alternate bidder for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • SODA

    Activist investor on the prowl at SodaStream

    • Teleios Capital Partners discloses that it holds 1.2M shares of SodaStream (SODA +1%). The tally works out to a 5.7% stake in the sparkling water company.
    • Teleios confirms it entered into a dialogue with SodaStream management and will seek to increase shareholder value by focusing on current board composition and corporate governance.
    • SodaStream hit a 52-week high of $36.20 earlier this afternoon.
    • SEC Form 13D
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • ALK

    Alaska Air-Virgin America deal reportedly very close to final settlement

    • Alaska Air Group (ALK +0.8%) is close to settling with the U.S. government on terms for its acquisition of Virgin America (NASDAQ:VA), according to Bloomberg.
    • Virgin America is up 1.80% to $56.45 vs. the $57 deal price.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • SHIP

    Seanergy Marine -27% on news of 1.3M-share offering at $2.75/share

    • Seanergy Marine (SHIP -27.2%) sinks following a trading halt after announcing the pricing of a 1.3M-share offering at $2.75/share, a significant discount to current prices.
    • SHIP says it plans to use the $3.3M in net proceeds from the offering for general corporate purposes, including vessel acquisitions.
    • SHIP was part of yesterday's swoon in shipping company stocks, plunging 46%; shares have now shed ~60% since peer DryShips announced its own share sale yesterday morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 3 Comments
  • GBIM

    GlobeImmune shakes up management after Gilead returns GS-4774; shares down 32%

    • Thinly traded nano cap GlobeImmune (OTC:GBIM -32.4%) slumps on increased volume in the news that Gilead Sciences (GILD -1.4%) has returned HBV therapeutic vaccine candidate GS-4774 to the company.
    • It also announced changes in executive management: CEO Timothy Rodell has resigned, but remains a board member; C. Jeffery Dekker has been appointed President, Secretary and Treasurer and has been named to the board and board members J. William Freytag, Augustine Lawlor, Dan Mitchell and S. Edward Torres have resigned.
    • And finally, the company has terminated its lease for the 40K square feet of office space that served as its headquarters, laboratory and manufacturing site.
    • In July, GlobeImmune filed for voluntary delisting from the Nasdaq Capital Market.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 6 Comments

  • Consumer Goods - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 pm

    • Gainers: SYUT +18%. OTIV +9%. TPB +8%. FORD +6%. VOXX +6%.
    • Losers: VRTV -12%. KODK -9%. SPU -8%. ZX -8%. GIII -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: FAC +6%. KCG +6%. TREE +6%. PGC +6%. CNOB +6%.
    • Losers: OTC:FNBC -19%. WMIH -6%. CPSS -6%. WRLD -6%. FIBK -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • GFI

    Gold Fields pulls proposal to acquire Kirkland Lake

    • Gold Fields (GFI -2.1%) says it has withdrawn its joint offer with Silver Standard Resource (SSRI -0.6%) to buy Kirkland Lake Gold (KGILF -2.9%).
    • GFI says it would remain interested in pursuing negotiations with Kirkland Lake if the latter's shareholders reject the proposed C$1B ($764M) takeover of Newmarket Gold (OTCQX:NMKTF); Kirkland Lake's vote is expected on Nov. 25.
    • Kirkland earlier this week confirmed that GFI and SSRI had made three joint bids for the company and recently sweetened their offer to ~C$1.4B.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • MRVL

    Barclays sidelined on Marvell Technology despite Q3 strength

    • Analyst Blayne Curtis raises his target from $12 to $14 (current price $14.54), highlights storage and better-than-expected networking growth, and points out the positive signal a newly authorized $1B share buyback represents.
    • Attributed to ongoing restructuring initiatives, however, keeps Marvell Technology (MRVL +9.1%) shares at Equal Weight until the effort plays out.
    • Also today: Marvell Technology upgraded at Susquehanna
    • Yesterday: Marvell Technology +7%; Q3 over projections, $1B repurchase program authorized
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: SGNL +59%. SBSA +43%. TNDM +31%. KBIO +28%. TRCH +21%. EYEG +21%. STEM +20%. SYUT +18%. DCIX +17%. CLD +15%.
    • Losers: SCON -34%. CETC -31%. GSL -24%. OTC:FNBC -20%. ESEA -17%. BNSO -17%. GPS -16%. RLOG -16%. CYCC -15%. ANF -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 7 Comments
  • ASML

    Large- and mid-cap stocks with strong relative volume today

    • Large-cap names with 5x their normal volume:
    • ASML Holding (ASML +1.7%)
    • The Gap (GPS -16.5%)
    • Mid-caps with 5x their normal volume:
    • HRG Group (HRG +3.8%)
    • Grand Canyon Education (LOPE -0.1%)
    • Marvell Tech (MRVL +8.8%)
    • Nuance Communication (NUAN +9.6%)
    • Post Holdings (POST -2.1%)
    • Regal Entertainment (RGC -2.2%)
    • ViaSat (VSAT +4.9%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • AKTX

    Akari hits post-merger low as investors remain on sidelines; shares down 7%

    • Akari Therapeutics (AKTX -7.1%) still can't find a friend after the September merger between Celsus Therapeutics and Volution Immuno Pharmaceuticals that produced the new identity. Share are exchanging hands at ~$7.15, a new low and down over 20% since September 21.
    • Akari's lead product candidate is Conversin, a second-generation complement inhibitor in development for the treatment of rare disorders paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH), atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS) and Guillain Barre syndrome (GBS).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • BUD

    Large- and mid-caps hitting 52-week highs/lows today

    • In no surprise given the market's one-way street upwards for some time, the list of 52-week highs in large- and mid-cap stocks is too long to list. Suffice it to say, if you own a financial name and it's not at a 52-week high, call management.
    • Of far more interest given the major bull run, which names are making 52-week lows?
    • Anheuser-Busch (BUD -1.6%)
    • Fomento Economico Mexicano (FMX -2.8%)
    • National Grid (NGG -0.8%)
    • Novo Nordisk (NVO -1%)
    • Grupo Televisa  (TV -3.3%)
    • Unilever (UL -1%)
    • CubeSmart (CUBE -1.4%)
    • Extra Space Storage (EXR -0.4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 1 Comment

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: SGNL +56%. KBIO +26%. EYEG +23%. TNDM +16%. STEM +13%.
    • Losers: APRI -15%. CYCC -14%. BPTH -14%. DRNA -10%. ROKA -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 2 Comments
  • FSLR

    First Solar cut to Sell at UBS, as cash burn to continue into 2018

    • First Solar (FSLR -4.4%) is now ~9% lower since Wednesday's release of disappointing 2017 guidance (I, II, III), and UBS sees further risk to expectations in 2018 and beyond as it downgrades shares to Sell from Neutral with a $25 price target, cut from $45.
    • UBS cautions that "cash burn likely [will] continue into 2018 with limited cash generation from system sales, more than offset with continued need to scale capex on full 3GW Series 6 deployment of a further $500M," and expects cash generation to remain modest in 2018 and beyond.
    • With 2017 EPS guidance below expectations at $0-$0.50 and a meaningful improvement expected thereafter, UBS expects "another step-change down... we see risk should margins trend lower and/or system opportunities continue to trend below guided volume expectations."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 21 Comments
  • FNBC

    First NBC in consent order with FDIC; plunges 26%

    • The bank entered into a consent order with the FDIC on Nov. 10 in which it's agreed (among other items) to review management, its loan review and problem loan identification processes, as well as formulate a strategic plan.
    • Thanks to the delay of its 10-Q filing, First NBC (OTC:FNBC -26.1%) has also received a de-listing notice from Nasdaq, and has until Jan. 17 to submit a plan to regain compliance.
    • The bank says it continues to consider all strategic options, but has made no decision yet.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • CRM

    Salesforce coverage broadly confident subsequent Q3 report

    • Buy, Outperform and associated positive ratings are reissued at Goldman Sachs (Conviction Buy), BTIG, Citi, Wunderlich Securities, Brean Capital and Barclays with respective targets set at $96, $100, $95, $101, $110 and $89.
    • Salesforce (CRM +3.5%) shares are presently trading at $77.97, approximately 2% below pre-Q2 reporting levels. The prior quarter had sparked some concern (isolated U.S. softness etc.), though sentiment at present remains firmly in positive territory.
    • Yesterday – Salesforce +5%; Q3 over expectations, $10B revenue forecast set for 2018
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 3 Comments
  • HAVSF

    Havas chief: Merger with Vivendi would 'make sense'

    • A merger between ad group Havas (OTCPK:HAVSF) and media giant Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY -3.5%) is "an assumption that makes sense," says Havas chief Yannick Bollore. "It would be a development project rather than a cost-saving project."
    • He says Havas isn't in any formal talks with Vivendi -- chaired by his father Vincent, who owns 60% of Havas. Vincent has said that the two companies should work more closely, with a possible merger later; meanwhile, Exane BNP Paribas sees a merger happening as soon as Q2 2017.
    • "Big content could bring a lot to advertising and advertising could bring a lot to Vivendi's entertainment world," Yannick Bollore said on the sidelines of the Morgan Stanley conference in Barcelona.
    • Vivendi makes up 0.05% of Havas revenues, and Havas clients make up less than 1% of Vivendi's revenues, Yannick says.
    • Shares of Havas are up 0.5% in Paris.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • HGEN

    KaloBios tries a reversal of fortune; shares up 21%

    • The rollercoaster in nano cap biotechs is alive and well. KaloBios Pharmaceuticals (KBIO +21.2%) jumps on a modest 75K shares on no particular news. Shares had lost over 40% of their value since last month before reversing.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • EYEG

    EyeGate Pharma up 30% on approval pathway for ocular bandage gel

    • EyeGate Pharmaceuticals (EYEG +30.3%) moves up on a healthy 15x surge in volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has agreed to review its regulatory submission for EyeGate Ocular Bandage Gel under the De Novo 510(k) pathway.
    • Previously: FDA OKs De Novo approval pathway for EyeGate Ocular Bandage Gel (Nov. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 2 Comments
  • MGEN

    Signal Genetics jumps out the gate, shares up 66%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Signal Genetics (SGNL +66.3%) rockets up on a 17x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 215K shares.
    • A merger with miRagen Therapeutics was announced at the end of October. The combined clinical-stage firm will focus its development efforts on micro RNA-targeting therapeutics. Its beginning cash balance should be more than $50M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • MRVL

    Marvell Technology upgraded at Susquehanna

    • Analyst Christoper Rolland moves from Neutral to Positive subsequent Marvell Technology's (NASDAQ:MRVL) strong Q3 report.
    • Shares are higher by 8.3% to $14.47 early.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • VSAT

    ViaSat prices public offering; shares +3.7%

    • ViaSat (NASDAQ:VSAT) is up 3.7% to $72.29 after announcing it priced a public offering at $69.74.
    • That's yesterday's closing price; shares had fallen on Wednesday and Thursday after news of the offering.
    • The closing of the sale is expected on Wednesday. Gross proceeds of about $436.9M will be used for general purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 2 Comments
  • ROST

    Ross Stores tears a big hole in election anxiety theory in retail

    • Comparable sales rose 7% for Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) in Q3. The solid mark stacks up nicely against peers and coincides with a period for which some retail execs claimed election anxiety weighed down consumer spending.
    • Ross didn't say anything about a stressed-out consumer. "We are very pleased with our better-than-expected sales and earnings growth in the third quarter as customers responded favorably to the compelling values we offered throughout our stores," noted CEO Barbara Rentler.
    • Operating margin during the quarter rose 55 bps to 12.6% of sales.
    • ROST +3.77% premarket to $68.00. Shares are up 22% YTD and are likely to open at a 52-wwek high.
    • Previously: Ross Stores beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Nov. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 6 Comments
  • KTOS

    Kratos Defense to launch 11.67M-share offering

    • Kratos Defense and Security (NASDAQ:KTOS) -9.5% premarket after pricing its public offering of 11.67M common shares at $6.00/share; underwriters will have an option to purchase up to an additional 1.75M shares.
    • KTOS says it plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes, including funding expected growth and strategic investments in its high performance unmanned aerial vehicle business and other new programs under contract.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • SEEL

    Apricus Bio expects to resubmit Vitaros NDA next year; now considered drug-device combination; shares down 22% premarket

    • Based on FDA feedback, Apricus Biosciences (APRI) says it has a clear path to resubmitting its New Drug Application (NDA) seeking approval of topical erectile dysfunction cream Vitaros sometime in 2017. The company received a CRL in 2008 in response to its original filing.
    • The agency has requested additional analyses of existing clinical and non-clinical data but did not indicate that new clinical studies would be required. It did state, though, that Vitaros is now considered a drug-device combination which will involve the Office of Product Quality to confirm device engineering and compliance requirements for the NDA resubmission.
    • Investors apparently perceive that this may delay the process. Shares are down 22% premarket on modest volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM

  • Euro on longest losing streak ever

    • The euro (NYSEARCA:FXE) has managed to climb back to positive territory vs. the greenback in the past couple of hours, but if it closes the session in the red, it would be the 10th consecutive day of losses - thus extending its longest-ever losing steak against the dollar.
    • At its high on election night, the euro was at $1.13, but this morning can buy just $1.0622. The next level technicians are watching is the $1.0538 low hit last December. Beyond that, there's the $1.0456 hit in March 2015.
    • If that breaks, is parity next?
    • ETFs: FXE, EUO, ERO, DRR, ULE, EUFX, URR
     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM | 8 Comments
  • NTRP

    Neurotrope inks $20M capital raise at substantial discount

    • Neurotrope (NASDAQ:NTRP) enters into a Securities Purchase Agreement with certain investors to issue 100,917,500 shares of common stock and five-year warrants to purchase an equivalent number of shares of common at a combined price of $0.20. The warrants are exercisable at $0.40.
    • Gross proceeds will be $20.2M. Under the terms of the agreement, it may sell additional shares of stock and related warrants to one or more buyers before the end of the month.
    • Net proceeds will fund the development of Bryostatin.
    • Yesterday's close was $0.52.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • TSLA

    Investors keep the faith on Tesla Motors

    • Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) cleared a nice hurdle when shareholders overwhemingly approved the company's merger with SolarCity, although major challenges are still ahead.
    • The GOP sweep on November 8 is seen as putting government support for the renewable energy industry at risk. It's also no secret that Tesla has a heavy debt load in front of the Model 3 production ramp up. The SolarCity business is targeted to add $1B to Tesla's revenue in 2017 and $500M in cash over three years. Cost savings of $150M per year are also promised.
    • "I think your faith will be rewarded," CEO Elon Musk told shareholders yesterday.
    • Analysts are divided of course, although it's notable that a few more have upped long-term revenue projections for the energy side of the business.
    • Tesla trades with a market cap of $28.66B, compared to Ford at $47.1B and GM at $50.9B.
    • TSLA +1.24% premarket to $191.00
     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM | 107 Comments
  • GPS

    Analysts take a crack at Gap after earnings

    • Citi moves to a Sell rating on Gap (NYSE:GPS) after digesting the company's earnings report and conference call. Analyst Paul Lejuez thinks the Gap brand will continue to struggle. He notes Q4 is off to weak start for the retailer.
    • Cowen rates Gap at Market Perform and assigns a price target of $25. The firm says traffic is still the key risk.
    • Wells Fargo is worried that guidance from Gap for the key holiday period only limped in even after merchandise margins improved in Q3. WF keeps a Market Perform rating and sets a valuation range of $24 to $25 on Gap.
    • Jefferies thinks Q3 was a bottoming out of fundamentals for Gap. The firm's Buy rating and $36 price target stand out.
    • Previously: Gap EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Nov. 17)
    • Previously: Old Navy shows improvement for Gap in Q3 (Nov. 17)
    • Gap -6.81% premarket to $28.62.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy inks deal for carbon capture study in Canadian oil sands

    • FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) +8.3% premarket on news it signed a contract with Alberta Innovates for an engineering study on a fuel cell carbon capture application at a heavy oil thermal facility owned by Husky Energy (OTCPK:HUSKF) in Saskatchewan.
    • FCEL says it will develop and prove the application for a carbon capture configured megawatt-class fuel cell power plant to simultaneously concentrate and capture carbon while producing ultra-clean power.
    • A second potential site, the Scotford bitumen upgrading facility in Alberta, will be evaluated as part of the study; the upgrader is part of the Athabasca Oil Sands Project, a joint venture between operator Shell (RDS.A, RDS.B), Chevron (NYSE:CVX) and Marathon Oil (NYSE:MRO).
     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM | 9 Comments
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch down sharply after sluggish earnings

    • Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) fall sharply after the Q3 results disappoint.
    • Same-store sales fell 6.0% during the quarter amid traffic headwinds at domestic malls.
    • SSS by brand: Abercrombie -14%, Hollister flat.
    • Gross profit as a percentage of sales decreased 150 bps to 62.2%. Operating income as a percentage of sales fell 230 bps to 2.4%.
    • FY16 outlook from A&F: Comparable sales growth in Q4 is expected to be challenging, but "modestly improved" from the third quarter.
    • Previously: Abercrombie & Fitch misses by $0.19, misses on revenue (Nov. 18)
    • ANF -13.76% premarket to $14.60.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM | 6 Comments
  • DXLG

    More on Destination XL Group's Q3

    • Destination XL Group (NASDAQ:DXLG) reports comparable-store sales rose 0.9% in Q3.
    • DXL retail stores comp delivered 2.3% growth in the quarter.
    • Total transactions in DXL stores grew 1.8% Y/Y.
    • Gross margin rate down 60 bps to 44.4%.
    • Merchandise margins slipped 30 bps Y/Y due to a shift in the timing of clearance markdowns.
    • SG&A expense rate improved 200 bps to 40.6% due to decreases in advertising costs and incentive accruals.
    • EBITDA up 57% to $3.9M.
    • Inventories -3.8% to $128.2M.
    • Store count -2 Y/Y to 352.
    • FY2016 Guidance: Total sales: $451M to $457M; Total comp sales: +1% to +2%; Gross margin rate: ~46%; EBITDA: $30M to $33M; GAAP EPS:-$0.09 to $0; Non-GAAP EPS: -$0.05 to $0; Capex: ~$30M; Store count: 341.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM
  • CYH

    Community Health divests Rockwood Health for $425M

    • Community Health Systems (NYSE:CYH) inks an agreement to sell Rockwood Health System to MultiCare Health System for $425M, subject to adjustments. The deal includes the 388-bed Deaconess Hospital in Spokane, 123-bed Valley Hospital in Spokane Valley and the multi-specialty Rockwood Clinic, all located in Washington.
    • The transaction should close in Q1 2017. CYH will use the proceeds to pay down debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 AM | 17 Comments
  • CVT

    Cvent takeover officially cleared by Justice

    • As reported yesterday, the sale of Cvent (NYSE:CVT) to Vista Equity Partners has been greenlighted by the DOJ. CVT rose 16.6% in late action yesterday, and is higher by 0.65% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 AM
  • ACRS

    Aclaris prices equity offering; shares off 2% premarket

    • Aclaris Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ACRS) prices its public offering of 4M shares of common stock at $22.75. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 600K shares. Closing date is November 23. Net proceeds will fund the regulatory submissions for A-101 Topical Solution for the treatment of seborrheic keratosis, the build out of a direct sales force to promote A-101, continued R&D related to A-101 for other indications, the development of ATI-50001 and ATI-50002, working capital and general corporate purposes.
    • Share are down 2% premarket on light volume. Yesterday's close was $23.82.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM
  • FL

    More on Foot Locker's Q3

    • Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) reports comparable-store sales rose 4.7% in Q3.
    • Excluding the effect of foreign currency fluctuations, sales increased 5.5% for the period.
    • Gross margin rate grew 10 bps to 33.9%.
    • SG&A expense rate improved 20 bps to 19.4%.
    • Merchandise inventories +1.9% $1.36B.
    • Store count -38 Y/Y to 3,394.
    • FL -1.89% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 AM
  • NEWM

    New Media prices offering

    • New Media Investment Group (NYSE:NEWM) prices its public offering to bring in $120M in gross proceeds.
    • The company has 44.87M shares outstanding and closed yesterday with a market cap of $744.04M.
    • NEWM -3.28% premarket to $16.20.
    • Previously: New Media -2.4% on 7.5M-share public offering (Nov. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 AM
  • SPPI

    FDA rejects Spectrum Pharma's NDA for QAPZOLA

    • As expected, Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SPPI) receives a Complete Response Letter (CRL) from the FDA regarding its New Drug Application (NDA) seeking approval of QAPZOLA (apaziquone) for the immediate intravesical instillation post-transurethral resection of bladder tumors in patients with non-muscle invasive bladder cancer.
    • The company met with the review team earlier this week to discuss the next steps and is evaluating a new smaller clinical trial that would replace the ongoing Phase 3 program that has stopped enrollment.
    • In September, the FDA's advisory committee voted 14-0 against approval.
    • Previously: Ad Comm review today for Spectrum Pharma's apaziquone (Sept. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:52 AM
  • HIBB

    More on Hibbett Sports' Q3

    • Hibbett Sports (NASDAQ:HIBB) reports comparable-store sales rose 0.7% in Q3.
    • Gross profit rate declined 70 bps to 35.4% due to markdowns taken to reduce inventory, a negative effect of product mix and de-leverage of logistics and store occupancy expenses associated with lower comparable store sales.
    • Store operating, selling, and administrative expenses rate expanded 250 bps to 23.6%.
    • Operating margin rate squeezed 330 bps to 9.8%.
    • Store count +31 Y/Y to 1,067.
    • FY2017 Guidance: Merchandise margin: relatively flat; Diluted EPS: $2.82 to $2.88.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 AM
